intro: Rhododendron przewalskii subsp. yushuense, commonly known as the Yushu rhododendron, is a shrub native to the high altitudes of western China. It is characterized by its dark green, leathery leaves and clusters of bell-shaped, pink to reddish-purple flowers. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and is adapted to the harsh conditions of its alpine habitat. It is typically found in mountainous regions with well-drained soil. The subspecies is notable for its ornamental value and ecological significance in its native ecosystem.
